_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

1. Facility Policy. The owners, management and employees of Farmers Union Cooperative Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases
of  anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, the Webster County LEPC, and/or
other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2. Facility Information. The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers, the end users. Anhydrous ammonia is the
chemical covered by the Risk Management Program. It is received, stored and distributed to the farmers, the end users.

3. Accidental Release Prevention Program. The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous
Ammonia, K61.1 published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration
(OSHA), 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia."

4. Five-Year Accident History. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries
or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage, or environmental
damage.

5. Emergency Response Program. We do not plan to have our employees respond to a release of anhydrous ammonia. We have an Emergency Action
Plan and in case of a release of anhydrous ammonia we will notify the LEPC, SERC, NRC, and other appropriate authorities.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety. Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. We conduct yearly safety meetings, safety equipment checks,
and check emergency spill equipment procedures. We are currently updating our Prevention Program.
